original_prompt: In this task you are given a tweet that contains some form of irony. You must classify the type of irony the tweet has. Label the tweets ("polarity","situational","other") based on the irony they have. Situational irony happens when a situation fails to meet some expectations, Label these instances as "situational". polarity irony happens when irony is achieved by inverting the intended sentence, Label these instances as "polarity". There are other kinds of ironies that are neither polarity nor situational, Label these instances as "other". Note that URLs in the text have been replaced with [Link].
generated_prompts: In this task, you will receive a tweet with some form of irony. You must classify the type of irony it has and label the tweet accordingly. If the irony is achieved by inverting the intended sentence, label it as "polarity". If the irony is due to a situation failing to meet some expectations, label it as "situational". If the irony is neither polarity nor situational, label it as "other". Note that URLs in the text have been replaced with [Link].

You will be given a tweet that contains some form of irony. Your task is to classify the type of irony the tweet has and label the tweets according to the irony they have. If the tweet contains situational irony, which is when a situation fails to meet some expectations, label it as "situational". If the tweet contains polarity irony, which is when irony is achieved by inverting the intended sentence, label it as "polarity". If the tweet contains other kinds of irony that are neither polarity nor situational, label it as "other". Note that any URLs in the text have been replaced with [Link].

In this task, you are given a tweet that contains some form of irony. You must classify the type of irony the tweet has and label the tweets as either "polarity", "situational", or "other". "Polarity" irony happens when irony is achieved by inverting the intended sentence, and "situational" irony occurs when a situation fails to meet some expectations. If the irony is neither polarity nor situational, label it as "other". URLs in the tweet have been replaced with [Link].
